dialogues.introduce: Um… I'm Sáng/Mây. I just moved in, staying in room 202. I hope you can help me.
dialogues.thought: Hmm, this neighbor doesn’t seem very friendly.
dialogues.hesitate: Should I keep talking? I don't want to make her mad.

dialogues.duration_reply: Two years. But people in room 202 never stay long.

dialogues.follow_up: Hello, sister. Yesterday, you said people don't stay long here. What did you mean?
dialogues.warning: No one who lived in that room stayed for more than a week.

dialogues.greet: Hello, sister! We meet again. This place is so quiet. Has everyone gone home?
dialogues.reply: Most people here are students, so they leave early.
dialogues.answer: Yeah, I study at X University.
dialogues.remark: Oh, same school as me! I'm a second-year student. What year are you?
dialogues.response: Fourth year. Guess that makes us acquaintances now.
dialogues.mention: Do you know Thơ? I found her student ID in my room. She’s from your batch.
dialogues.reaction: No, I don’t know her. That ugly girl was hated by the whole batch.

dialogues.reply: I don’t think I’ll go home this year. My family’s situation is a bit difficult, so I want to stay and work to earn some extra money for them.
dialogues.acknowledge: That’s quite hardworking of you. I’m heading home this afternoon. Be careful staying here alone at night—it’s not safe. Everyone in this boarding house is going home. Just giving you a heads-up.
dialogues.worry: Not safe? Is there something wrong with my room?
dialogues.warn: Ask the landlady and you'll know. Also, the landlord is a pervert—he's harassed girls before, so you better be careful.
